properties.Title: Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory For The Village Of Macoun
properties.Summary:
Description: A Precautionary Drinking Water Advisory has been issued for the Village of Macoun. This advisory is for the Village of Macoun and for any individuals who may access water from the Macoun water system. This advisory is in effect until Wednesday October 14, 2020
Expires: 2020-10-14T12:00:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: SK Macoun, 2020-10-05T15:42:53-06:00, 991282C0-DF0C-EDC8-E067-A50A199C3770
Area: Village of Macoun
properties.Author: SK Macoun

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A disturbance tracking northeastward across Hudson Bay will bring wet snow and strong winds to the Kimmirut region. Flurries, already in the region today, could produce a few centimetres of snow. However tonight, as the system approaches the Hudson Strait, the snow will become more organized. Snowfall accumulations of 5 to 10 cm will be possible although amounts will be highly dependent on surface temperatures and whether the snow becomes mixed with rain. A few more centimetres of wet snow are possible on Tuesday before gradually tapering off late in the day. In addition to the snow, strong southeasterly winds will also develop tonight, gusting at times to 70 km/h, before moderating Tuesday afternoon. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-06T00:28:16-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-05T08:29:16-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2850994659.2020
Area: Kimmirut
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Significant rainfall is expected. Locations: Channel-Port aux Basques to Burgeo - Ramea. Total rainfall: possibly exceeding 50 mm. Time span: Wednesday morning until Thursday afternoon or evening. Remarks: Periods of rain will develop on Wednesday morning and likely become heavy, at times, on Wednesday night. The rain is expected to taper off late on Thursday. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-10-06T10:38:57-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-05T18:39:57-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2041404959.2020
Area: Burgeo - Ramea, Channel-Port aux Basques and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
